text:
M. S. NOVIK
300 WEST 23rd STREET • ROOM 500 • NEW YORK 11, N. Y. ♦ ALGONQUIN 5-4385
RADIO
CONSULTANT
April 9, 1956
My dear Harry:
Re yonr April !±th letter, I will send the hill to you
in a day or two. Of course, the arrangement about the
$625.00 is perfectly 0. K. with me.
Re the Fall convention, as far as I am concerned, I am going
to try to be there. The only things that may stop me
would be the activities of the political campaign or some
special program which might jam me up. Of course, I will be
glad to submit a brief report if Frank should want it.
Re Columbus, I plaAbo be there, so please don't worry about
making an official request. I don't want to use up your
fund needlessly. If there is nded for me at the regional
meeting, I will keep May l+th or 6th clear.
M. S. Novik
Mr. Harry Skornia, Executive Director
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
University of Illinois
119 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Copies to: Mr. Bob Coleman
Frank E. Schooley
